intro: Amanoa tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly amanoa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often covered in a dense layer of fine, white pubescence. Amanoa tomentosa is considered a rare and endemic species, facing threats from habitat loss and invasive species.
